intro: Euphorbia helioscopia, commonly known as the sun spurge, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and northern Africa. It is a low-growing herbaceous perennial that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers clustered in spherical structures called cyathia, which are characteristic of the Euphorbiaceae family. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy coating, while its stems are covered in fine, white hairs. Euphorbia helioscopia is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and sunny environments.
